town.translation[0].definitions[0].defin: a large area with houses, shops, offices etc where people live and work, that is smaller than a city and larger than a village
town.translation[0].definitions[0].examp: an industrial town in the Midlands
I walked to the nearest town.
town.translation[0].definitions[1].defin: the business or shopping centre of a town
town.translation[0].definitions[1].examp: We’re going into town tonight to see a film.
They have a small apartment in town.
town.translation[0].definitions[2].defin: all the people who live in a particular town
town.translation[0].definitions[2].examp: The whole town turned out to watch the procession.
town.translation[0].definitions[3].defin: the town or city where you live
town.translation[0].definitions[3].examp: Cam left town about an hour ago, so he should be out at the farm by now.
I’ll be out of town for about a week.
Guess who’s in town? Jodie’s sister!
Do you know of a good place to eat? I’m from out of town (=from a different town).
We’re moving to another part of town.
town.translation[0].definitions[4].defin: several houses forming a small group around a church, shops etc
town.translation[0].definitions[4].examp: Rowayton is a small town of around 4,000 people.

small/big

The nearest big town is 20 miles away.
a little town
a pretty little town in the French Alps
a major town
It is one of the UK’s biggest retailers with shops in every major town.
busy/bustling
The town was busy even in November.
The town is quiet in the summer.
Cannigione is a quiet little town with a scattering of shops, restaurants and cafés.
sleepy
Johnson grew up in the sleepy retirement town of Asheville.
a historic/ancient town
Visitors can go on a tour of this historic town.
an industrial town
Thousands moved to the newly forming industrial towns to work in the mills.
a seaside town
young people looking for seasonal work in seaside towns
a provincial town
Many provincial towns were transformed by the coming of the railway.
a market town
The pretty market town of Ashbourne is only 9 miles away.
somebody’s home town

a new town

the centre of town/the town centre

the outskirts/edge of a town
It was six o'clock when she reached the outskirts of the town.
